snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio said he had formed an emergency task force on so-called three-quarter houses for taking kickbacks on Medicaid fees for tenants’ drug treatment while forcing residents to live in squalid conditions.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio forms emergency task force to investigate abuses at so-called three-quarter houses, sober living facilities that are part of murky world of outpatient substance abuse treatment for the poor; is response to New York Times investigation finding that some homes took kickbacks on Medicaid fees for drug treatment while forcing tenants to live in abysmal, and illegal, conditions.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio said he had formed an emergency task force on so-called three-quarter houses for taking kickbacks on Medicaid fees for tenants’ drug treatment while forcing residents to live in squalid conditions.

headline.main: New York City Task Force to Investigate ‘Three-Quarter’ Homes
headline.print_headline: City Task Force to Investigate ‘Sober’ Homes
